intro: Anticharis juncea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed anticharis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and prominent stamens. Anticharis juncea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
